title: client server technology
extract: The client–server model is a distributed application structure that partitions tasks or workloads between the providers of a resource or service, called servers, and service requesters, called clients. ... A server host runs one or more server programs which share their resources with clients.
extract_html: The client–server model is a distributed application structure that partitions tasks or workloads between the providers of a resource or service, called servers, and service requesters, called clients. ... A server host runs one or more server programs which share their resources with clients.
